summary: 3D project using static (non-animated) characters/props with free 3D models (humans, dogs, and table/chair sets) sourced from Google.
architectural_notes: Asset sourcing plan: use free 3D models found via Google for humans, dogs, and table/chair sets (ensure compatible licensing).

existing_features.title: Stop all human movement in the cafe scene by removing the walking customer behavior and any per-frame animation updates affecting human transforms so all humans remain static in place.

Replace the current primitive-based human and dog characters with locally bundled, free 3D model assets (GLB/GLTF) sourced via Google search (free-to-use), and load them from the appâ€™s static assets rather than fetching from external URLs at runtime.

Replace the current procedural table and chair components with locally bundled, free 3D table/chair set models (GLB/GLTF) sourced via Google search (free-to-use), and use those models in both the basic fallback room and the full cafe environment furniture layout.
Add a simple attribution/license record for each third-party 3D model used (humans, dogs, tables/chairs), including source URL and license type, and ensure it is included in the repository.

new_feature_requests.summary: Use free 3D models from Google for humans, dogs, and table/chair sets (no character movement/animation).
